result.execSummary:
The defendant Matthew Steven Eberhart was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Matthew Steven Eberhart is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Matthew Steven Eberhart was found guilty of Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse - Infliction of Physical Pain or Injury], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Matthew Steven Eberhart was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: Domestic Abuse - Infliction of Physical Pain or Injury
Domestic Abuse - Infliction of Physical Pain or Injury

supervisions.notes:
- 1 day jail credit against ultimate sentence
- Eligible for early discharge from probation.
- Sign up for probation on 10/19/22 at 4:00 PM

In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

2:46 PM CO: Vlack, Reporter: Gross, Clerk: Christianson. Prosecuting attorney Brian Thomas Smestad in court for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Robert A Wertheimer in court for Matthew Steven Eberhart. Defendant Matthew Steven Eberhart in court. Court reviews case. recites resolution. Court questions Defendant. Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and rights. Defendant understands and pleads Guilty to Count 3: Battery WITH enhancer- 940.19(1) and Count 5: Disorderly Conduct WITH enhancer. Court finds that Defendant has freely and voluntarily entered plea and waived rights. Court accepts plea and finds sufficient facts. Court finds Defendant guilty. Upon motion of the State, Court dismisses Counts 1,2, and 4. Sentencing arguments. 

Court Orders:
 Count 3: W/S 2 Years Probation

- 120 days condition time STAYED
- Court Costs: $243.00. Apply Bond. Balance to be pd through Clerk of Court
- DNA Surcharge: $200.00. Apply Bond. Balance to be pd through Clerk of Court
- Domestic Surcharge $100.00. Apply Bond. Balance to be pd through Clerk of Court
1 day credit against ultimate sentence

 Count 5: I/S 45 days Jail. 2 Years Probation

- 30 days condition time STAYED
- Court Costs: $243.00. Apply Bond. Balance to be pd through Clerk of Court
- Domestic Surcharge: $100.00. Apply Bond. Balance to be pd through Clerk of Court
1 day credit against ultimate sentence

Conditions of Probation:

- DNA Sample
- Complete Domestic Violence Assessment- Completed and follow recommended treatment
- Cooperate with any other evaluation, assessment and/or program as requested
- Participate in Restorative Justice program 
- No Abusive Contact C.H.H.
- Subject to random UA's and PBT's
- Follow rules and regulations of Agent
- Pay supervision fees
- Sign up for probation on 10/19/22 by 04:00 PM

Eligible for early discharge from probation

Adjourned 03:04 PM

Prior: 208 Tainter Street W, Downing, WI 54734 United States
per Request

AMENDED

- $500.00 Cash Bond on file. 

- It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO ABUSIVE CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Children and C.H.H.  The term "abusive contact" is hereby defined as a verbal assault or an intentional infliction of or threat to inflict physical pain, physical injury or illness, an impairment of physical condition, and /or sexual contact or sexual intercourse without consent.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats. 

If the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bail jumping.

- $500.00 Cash Bond on file. 

- It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO ABUSIVE CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Children.  The term "abusive contact" is hereby defined as a verbal assault or an intentional infliction of or threat to inflict physical pain, physical injury or illness, an impairment of physical condition, and /or sexual contact or sexual intercourse without consent.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats. THIS CONDITION SHALL ONLY BE EFFECTIVE UPON THE EXPIRATION OF A 72 HOUR NO CONTACT ORDER.

If the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bail jumping.  

- It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, C.H.H, except for text re: Children; Exchanges take place at Hammond PD; children to go from one car to next.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

If the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bail jumping.
